EntryID.name: EntryID
EntryID.description: The unique ID of the entry. Via this ID all transaction lines of a single entry can be retrieved

AmountDC.name: AmountDC
AmountDC.description: Amount in the default currency of the company. For the header lines (LineNumber = 0) of an entry this is the SUM(AmountDC) of all lines

AmountFC.name: AmountFC
AmountFC.description: Amount in the currency of the transaction. For the header this is the sum of all lines, including VAT

BatchNumber.name: BatchNumber
BatchNumber.description: The number of the batch of entries. Normally a batch consists of multiple entries. Batchnumbers are filled for invoices created by: - Fixed entries - Prolongation (only available with module hosting)

Currency.name: Currency
Currency.description: Currency for the invoice. By default this is the currency of the administration

Description.name: Description
Description.description: Description of the entry. Can be different for the sales entry lines

Document.name: Document
Document.description: Document that is manually linked to the invoice

DueDate.name: DueDate
DueDate.description: The due date for payments. This date is calculated based on the EntryDate and the Paymentcondition

EntryNumber.name: EntryNumber
EntryNumber.description: Entry number, for sales invoices this is the invoice number

GAccountAmountFC.name: GAccountAmountFC
GAccountAmountFC.description: A positive value of the amount indicates that the amount is to be paid by the customer to your G bank account.In case of a credit invoice the amount should have negative value when retrieved or posted to Exact.

InvoiceNumber.name: InvoiceNumber
InvoiceNumber.description: Assigned at entry or at printing depending on setting. The number assigned is based on the freenumbers as defined for the Journal. When printing the field InvoiceNumber is copied to the fields EntryNumber and InvoiceNumber of the sales entry

IsExtraDuty.name: IsExtraDuty
IsExtraDuty.description: Indicates whether the invoice has extra duty

Journal.name: Journal
Journal.description: The journal code. Every invoice should be linked to a sales journal

OrderNumber.name: OrderNumber
OrderNumber.description: Number to indentify the invoice. Order numbers are not unique. Default the number is based on a setting for the first free number

PaymentCondition.name: PaymentCondition
PaymentCondition.description: The payment condition used for due date and discount calculation

PaymentConditionPaymentMethod.name: PaymentConditionPaymentMethod
PaymentConditionPaymentMethod.description: Payment method of Payment condition. Values: B = On credit, I = Collection, K = Cash

PaymentReference.name: PaymentReference
PaymentReference.description: The payment reference used for bank imports, VAT return and Tax reference

ProcessNumber.name: ProcessNumber
ProcessNumber.description: Internal processing number, only relevant for Germany

ReportingPeriod.name: ReportingPeriod
ReportingPeriod.description: The period of the transaction lines. The period should exist in the period date table

ReportingYear.name: ReportingYear
ReportingYear.description: The financial year to which the entry belongs. The financial year should exist in the period date table

Type.name: Type
Type.description: Type: 20 = Sales entry, 21 = Sales credit note

VATAmountDC.name: VATAmountDC
VATAmountDC.description: Vat amount in the default currency of the company

VATAmountFC.name: VATAmountFC
VATAmountFC.description: Vat amount in the currency of the transaction

WithholdingTaxAmountDC.name: WithholdingTaxAmountDC
WithholdingTaxAmountDC.description: Withholding tax amount, Spanish legislation only

WithholdingTaxBaseAmount.name: WithholdingTaxBaseAmount
WithholdingTaxBaseAmount.description: Withholding tax base amount to calculate withholding amount, Spanish legislation only

WithholdingTaxPercentage.name: WithholdingTaxPercentage
WithholdingTaxPercentage.description: Withholding tax percentage, Spanish legislation only

YourRef.name: YourRef
YourRef.description: Reference of the customer, like order number

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to create, read, update or delete sales entries as financial entries created for your sales invoices.Note: Sales entries are separated to header and line information. Endpoint SalesEntries is used for the header information. You must include a parameter for 'SalesEntryLines' to add sales entry lines when you POST to the SalesEntries endpoint. This parameter is not necessary when you PUT to this endpoint.  The relevance of properties  is very much depending on the legislation and the package used.
